intro: Austrobassia tatei, commonly known as the Tasmanian thornbush, is a shrub native to Tasmania, Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are typically narrow and leathery, adapted to the dry conditions of its native habitat. Austrobassia tatei is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is well-suited to coastal environments.
